tit.e: Ryoro (brazier used in Senchado [green tea ceremony])
Ryoro (brazier used in Senchado [green tea ceremony])

sen.j: 涼炉（りょうろ）は煎茶道で使用する湯を沸かす道具の一つ。
sen.e: Ryoro is a utensil used to boil water in senchado (the way of brewed green tea).
Ryoro is a utensil used to boil water in senchado.
sen.cmt: 前出補足を削除しました。
sen.e: Ryoro is a utensil used to boil water in senchado.

sen.j: 「焜炉」「茶炉」「風炉」とも言われる。
sen.e: It is also called konro (portable cooking stove), charo (furnace) and furo (furnace).
It is also called 'konro' (portable cooking stove), 'charo' (furnace) and 'furo' (furnace).
sen.cmt: クォーテーション補足しました。
sen.e: It is also called 'konro' (portable cooking stove), 'charo' (furnace) and 'furo' (furnace).

sen.j: 元々は中国で茶の野点用に野外で火をおこすために考えられた携帯湯沸かし器である。
sen.e: Originally ryoro was a portable water heater developed in China to use fire out door for Nodate (open-air tea ceremony).

sen.j: 古くなったり、使い終わった後は廃棄されるのが慣例であった。
sen.e: Conventionally it was disposed when it becomes old or after use.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: そのため手の掛かった彫刻や造形を施された物はほとんどない。
sen.e: Therefore there was hardly any ryoro with elaborated sculpture and design.
Therefore there was hardly any ryoro with elaborated sculpture and design.

sen.j: 江戸時代に日本に煎茶法が伝わったときに涼炉も一緒に伝来した。
sen.e: Ryoro was introduced to Japan together with senchaho (method of green tea) in Edo period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処明時代Ming period, 清時代Qing periodと統一するため、Edo periodとしました。
sen.e: Ryoro was introduced to Japan together with senchaho (method of green tea) in Edo period.
Ryoro was introduced to Japan together with senchaho (method of green tea) in Edo period.

sen.j: 舶来物であること、素焼きという素朴さが文人達の心を捕らえて、珍重されるようになった。
sen.e: The fact that ryoro was a foreign goods and simplicity of bisque (fired pottery) moved literati's heart and became prized.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: その後、清時代中期には中国本土でも凝った作りのものが生産されるようになった。
sen.e: Thereafter, ryoro with elaborated design started to be manufactured in China in the middle of the Qing period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: また日本でも注文に応じて装飾に富んだ物が生産されるようになった。

sen.j: 正面に風を送り込むための穴「風門」、上部に炭を入れ、ボーフラを載せる穴「火袋」がある。
sen.e: There is a hole to supply wind called fumon (wind's gate) at the front, and at the top section there is hibukuro (burning place of toro), a hole to put charcoal in and place bofura (ceramic kettle).

sen.e: As ryoro is a utensil used with flame to boil water, it is mostly a bisque (fired pottery), which can withstand high temperature.

sen.e: Recent years, ceramic ryoro with various decorations have also been produced, but many have a bisque part for hibukuro where fire is stoked.

sen.j: 近年は炭を熾す手間の問題や、特に公共団体が運営する茶室で屋内での火気の使用が制限されるケースが増えている。
sen.e: Recent years, there are some issues in use of ryoro such as trouble of maintaining charcoal fire, and a restriction of indoor fire usage, especially at chashitsu (tea-ceremony room) managed by public body.
